JNFP

Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • JNFP.Coordinate

  • public class Coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
    the class used for storing and using a coordinate
    Author:
    Stiaan Uyttersprot

      • calculateAngle

        public double calculateAngle(Coordinate coord2,
                             Coordinate coord3)
        Calculates the angle of three coordinates. The coordinate that calls the method is the middle coordinate, where the angle needs to be calculated
        Parameters:
        coord2 - the coordinate before this coordinate
        coord3 - the coordinate after this coordinate
        Returns:
        the angle formed by these three coordinates

      • dFunction

        public double dFunction(Coordinate startPoint,
                        Coordinate endPoint)
        D-function is used to calculate where a point is located in reference to an edge, given by it's start- and endpoint If the value is larger than 0 the point is on the left. If it is larger than 0 it's to the right. Equal to 0 then the point coincides with the edge. Dabp = ((Xa-Xb)*(Ya-Yp)-(Ya-Yb)*(Xa-Xp))
        Parameters:
        startPoint - the startpoint of the edge
        endPoint - the endpoint of the edge
        Returns:
        D-Function value

      • dFunction

        public double dFunction(Edge edge)
        D-function is used to calculate where a point is located in reference to an edge. If the value is larger than 0 the point is on the left. If it is larger than 0 it's to the right. Equal to 0 then the point coincides with the edge. Dabp = ((Xa-Xb)*(Ya-Yp)-(Ya-Yb)*(Xa-Xp))
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge for calculating the D-function
        Returns:
        D-Function value

      • dFunctionCheck

        public boolean dFunctionCheck(Coordinate startPoint,
                              Coordinate endPoint)
        Calculates the D-Function to check if the coordinate is placed on the edge given by start and endpoint or not.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - the startpoint of the edge
        endPoint - the endpoint of the edge
        Returns:
        if the point falls on the edge or not

      • dFunctionCheck

        public boolean dFunctionCheck(Edge edge)
        Calculates the D-Function to check if the coordinate is placed on the edge or not.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge the point may possibly be on
        Returns:
        if the point falls on the edge or not

        Parameters:

        Returns:
